newsitem.title: GREECE: Aluminium of Greece 96 profit down 54pct.
newsitem.headline: Aluminium of Greece 96 profit down 54pct.

text.p: Aluminium of Greece said its fiscal 1996 pretax profit fell 54 percent to $18.6 million from $41.2 million a year earlier.
The result was obtained in an environment of declining alumina and aluminium prices, it said.
Its board of directors will propose a dividend per share of $3.0 for 1996 versus $5.3 a year earlier.
"The beginning of 1997 showed improvement in aluminium prices and the dollar exchange rate. So far these elements are favourable, but at this time, they must be evaluated cautiously," it said.

Aluminium of Greece said an intensive cost reduction programme was being implemented, aimed at productivity gains. "It is accompanied by non-recurring restructuring costs which are taken care of in the 1996 accounts and important investments." --George Georgiopoulos, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
